conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう、助かるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通り。

conversation.en_sentence: We went with a new company for these cards this time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は新しい会社に依頼してみたんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, there was nothing wrong with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、特に何かがあったという訳ではないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: We ordered from them for the past five years and they did a great job.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼から過去5年間注文してたんだけど、良くやってくれたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We simply decided to try a new company this time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回はただ新しい会社を試してみることにしたんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: This new company has more choices for the layout and artwork on the business cards.
conversation.ja_sentence: この新しい会社はもっと沢山名刺のレイアウトとか図柄が選べるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Please let me know what you think of them when you see them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見たときにどう思うか教えてね。

conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった、ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you also for watching for the delivery today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 配達の件も見ててくれてありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what can I do for you?
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、なんの用でしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Did I say something wrong?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕、何か悪い事を言いましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Was it on the last call I made?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最後にかけた電話ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, when I asked the prospect if they had ever tried Product A?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、僕が見込み客に製品Aを試したことがあるかどうか聞いたことですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I apologize Christian.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、クリスチャン。

conversation.en_sentence: What am I allowed to say?
conversation.ja_sentence: どこまで言っても大丈夫なんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What should I keep confidential?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何を秘密にしておくべきなんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: It won't happen again.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう言わないようにします。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I understand.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、分かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I will not give out any trade secrets or tell anyone that we make Product A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 企業秘密は渡しませんし、製品Aを製造していることは誰にも言いません。

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely, that's what I will do moving forward.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、これからはそうします。

conversation.en_sentence: Our relationship with Company A is impressive, and that's why I bring it up in calls with prospects.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社とうちの関係はとても素晴らしいので、私は見込み客に電話するときにその話をするんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you mad at me?
conversation.ja_sentence: 怒ってますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I appreciate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 感謝します。

conversation.en_sentence: How long have we been a supplier for Company A anyways?
conversation.ja_sentence: ところでうちはどのくらいの期間A社の製品を製造しているんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to have kept you waiting.
conversation.ja_sentence: お待たせして申し訳ございませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: Please, come in.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうぞお入りください。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I've been looking forward to meeting you.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも、お会いするのを楽しみにしておりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Jones has told me a lot about you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョーンズさんからあなたの事は良く伺っております。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, he used to be my boss.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は彼は私の元上司なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, several years ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、何年か前ですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Jones taught me everything I know about business.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョーンズさんからはビジネスの全てを教わりました。

conversation.en_sentence: That's how I was able to start Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのおかげでB社を立ち上げることができました。

conversation.en_sentence: How do you know him?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼とはどのようなお知り合いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Please, have a seat.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうぞおかけください。

conversation.en_sentence: Make yourself comfortable.
conversation.ja_sentence: くつろいでください。

conversation.en_sentence: Would you like coffee or a bottle of water or something?
conversation.ja_sentence: コーヒーかペットボトルの水か何かいかがですか？

conversation.en_sentence: How do you like my new office?
conversation.ja_sentence: 我々の新しいオフィスはどうですか？

conversation.en_sentence: How much time do you have?
conversation.ja_sentence: お時間はどのくらいおありですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Would you like to have a tour of our facilities?
conversation.ja_sentence: 我々の施設を案内いたしましょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that would be very educational.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それはとても勉強になります。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I wish I knew how to do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、そんな風になりたいなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: How do they do that anyways?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてなんだろう。

conversation.en_sentence: I've never done that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私それやったことないわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Tell me about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな感じなの？

conversation.en_sentence: I can't do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出来ないわ。

conversation.en_sentence: I would be so embarrassed.
conversation.ja_sentence: 恥ずかしいもん。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, but everyone I know, I know for a reason.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、だけど知り合いには知り合いになる理由があるもの。

conversation.en_sentence: OK I'll try it.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、ちょっとやってみよう。

conversation.en_sentence: Something I would like to learn is how to create meaningful relationships with people.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は人々と有意義な関係を築く方法を勉強したいわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do they cover that?
conversation.ja_sentence: それも教えてる？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, like go out for lunch or go to happy hour or something.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、ランチに行ったりハッピーアワーに行ったり。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds very helpful.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごく役に立ちそう。

conversation.en_sentence: I want to look into that class too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も調べてみようかな。

conversation.en_sentence: Where can I find more information on it?
conversation.ja_sentence: どこに情報があるの？

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's really nice that they are willing to pay for it.
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、会社が払ってくれるなんていいね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to sign up today.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに申し込もうっと。

conversation.en_sentence: I am sincerely sorry about that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes there are a couple of things I can think of.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、思い当たる事が幾つかあります。

conversation.en_sentence: First of all, we are so short-handed.
conversation.ja_sentence: まず、人手不足です。

conversation.en_sentence: 4 staff were enough before our sales suddenly went up two months ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: 2か月前に突然販売数が増える前までは4人で充分でした。

conversation.en_sentence: I am not asking for another full-time staff.
conversation.ja_sentence: フルタイム従業員を一人増やしてと頼んでいる訳ではないです。

conversation.en_sentence: One part-time staff will take some of the burden off our existing staff.
conversation.ja_sentence: パートを一人増やすだけで、今いるスタッフの負担が少し減ります。

conversation.en_sentence: We are always pressured to handle and ship orders as fast as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 早急にオーダー対応し発送しないとというプレッシャーが常にあります。

conversation.en_sentence: We double check everything upon shipping.
conversation.ja_sentence: 発送の際には全てを二度チェックしています。

conversation.en_sentence: But handling a large amount of orders can be a bit overwhelming at time.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、大量のオーダー対応する事に圧倒されることもあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, we need labeling stickers that are more durable.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、もっと頑丈なラベルが必要です。

conversation.en_sentence: The ones we currently use are so flimsy and they rip easily.
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在使用中の物は薄っぺらで、すぐに破れてしまうんです。

conversation.en_sentence: When that happens, we have to recreate and print labels all over.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなると、また最初からラベル作成をし印刷しないといけないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I know we are on a budget here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 予算があるのは知っています。

conversation.en_sentence: But it will save us so much time and money if we use better labels that will not rip so easily.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、すぐに破れないラベルを使う事で時間もお金も節約できるはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for being understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解いただきありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: She has been working here for 25 years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 25年勤務されてるんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: She has definitely been a great asset to our company.
conversation.ja_sentence: わが社に大変貢献されてますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How about a surprise party?
conversation.ja_sentence: サプライズパーティーはどうでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I remember her telling me she had never had a surprise party thrown for her.
conversation.ja_sentence: サプライズパーティーをしてもらった事がないと以前田中さんが言ったのを覚えてます。

conversation.en_sentence: Something Mrs. Tanaka likes...
conversation.ja_sentence: 田中さんが好きな物はなんでしょうか・・・。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds like something she will really enjoy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 田中さんがとても喜びそうなパーティーですね。

conversation.en_sentence: There is a new Hawaiian restaurant in downtown.
conversation.ja_sentence: ダウンタウンに新しいハワイ料理のレストランがありますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We want as many colleagues as possible to show up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大勢の同僚に参加してもらいたいですからね。

conversation.en_sentence: We can decorate the room ourselves.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分たちで飾り付けできますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: The party supply store down the street carries lots of Luau themed decorations and supplies.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここの通りのパーティー用品店にはルアウパーティー用の品やデコレーションがたくさん売られてます。

conversation.en_sentence: We will get one at the party supply store.
conversation.ja_sentence: パーティー用品店で一緒に購入しましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: My friend's sister has one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の友人のお姉さんがやっていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: She is an amazing cook.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はとても腕の良いシェフです。

conversation.en_sentence: And she is very affordable.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして値段もお手軽です。

conversation.en_sentence: I can call now to set up an appointment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今から予約の電話をかけてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: I will get back to you guys as soon as I talk to her.
conversation.ja_sentence: 電話が終わり次第連絡しますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Ian, this is Sam.
conversation.ja_sentence: アイアンこんにちは、サムです。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to ask a question in regards to the invoice I received yesterday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日受け取った請求書について質問したいんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I was looking at the price and I noticed that the price is incorrect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 価格のところを見てて、価格間違いがあることに気づいたんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Specifically, the unit price for Product A is incorrect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的に言うと、A製品の単価に間違いがあったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: So that should actually be six hundred dollars per ton.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、実際には1トン当たり600ドルのはずだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: We raised the price since the last order.
conversation.ja_sentence: 前回の注文から値上げしたでしょ。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you send a revised version today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 訂正したものを今日送ってくれる？

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I wanted to talk about the shipment for next quarter.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、次の四半期の出荷について話したかったんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I know we usually order twenty tons a month but would it be possible to increase the volume?
conversation.ja_sentence: 通常は月に20トン注文しているけど、量を増やすことはできるだろうか？

conversation.en_sentence: The customer is hoping he can get twenty five tons per month for the next quarter.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様は次の四半期は月に25トンほど欲しいそうだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you think that's possible?
conversation.ja_sentence: できると思うかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, please let me know.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった、では知らせてね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、また。

conversation.en_sentence: What happened?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたんだい？

conversation.en_sentence: What, how did that happen?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何、どうしてそんな事になったんだい？

conversation.en_sentence: You are usually on top of my schedule and don't make a mistake like this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はいつも私の予定管理をしっかりしているから、この様なミスはしないじゃないか。

conversation.en_sentence: Which one was scheduled first?
conversation.ja_sentence: どちらが最初に予定されてたんだい？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, we need to keep that then.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、そちらを優先して。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yes, I am well aware of that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、よくわかっているよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We are in a bind here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 困った事になりましたね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, she has always been flexible with us.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、彼女はいつも融通が利くからな。

conversation.en_sentence: I suppose we will move up her meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ彼女とのミーティングを変更する事にしようか。

conversation.en_sentence: An hour should be enough time for our meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティングをは一時間あれば十分なはずだから。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why I only trust my schedule with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから私の予定を頼むのは君だけにしてるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Nobody is as organized as you are.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君みたいにとても計画的性のある人はいないから。

conversation.en_sentence: Please tell her I will be calling Ms. Willis in a little bit as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の方からもウィリスさんに電話を入れる事を伝えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: I need to personally make an apology for this.
conversation.ja_sentence: この件について個人的に謝らないといけないな。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, can you call Mr.Kitano's office to give a confirmation about the meeting?
conversation.ja_sentence: それから北野さんのオフィスに電話してミーティングの確認をいれておいて。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for all you do for me, Kira.
conversation.ja_sentence: キラさん、私の元で働いてくれて有難う。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: So we narrowed it down to these three.
conversation.ja_sentence: この三人に絞り込めましたね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: This is going to be a tough decision to make.
conversation.ja_sentence: なかなか難しい選択になりそうですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: Here are our three top candidates.
conversation.ja_sentence: 有力候補はこちらの三人です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: Sato Misaki with the longest experience in the marketing field.
conversation.ja_sentence: マーケティング業界で一番経験が豊富な佐藤 美咲さん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: Ben Harmon with an impressive resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしい履歴書をお持ちのベン ハーモンさん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: And Sanjay Patel who helped Company E's product become one of the top selling items this year.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして今年E社の商品をトップセラーにする事に貢献したサンジェイ パテルさん。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: How about Ben?
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさんはどうでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: He graduated from one of the best business schools in the States.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼はアメリカで一番を争うビジネススクールを卒業していますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: He is very knowledgeable and promising as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 知識豊富だし、有望です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: We can also count his internship at M corporation as his experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: Mコーポレーションでのインターンシップの経験も考慮しましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: But she seems to have steady performance.
conversation.ja_sentence: パフォーマンスは安定しているようです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: I actually know one of her old co-workers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女の元同僚を知っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: He talks so highly of her.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女の事とても良く言ってますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: I vote for him too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も彼に一票です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: So we have come to a conclusion.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結論が出ました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ダニー スペクター
conversation.en_sentence: Sanjay Patel will be the one.
conversation.ja_sentence: サンジェイ パテルさんに決定です。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for calling K food, this is Micah.
conversation.ja_sentence: Kフードにお電話頂き有難うございます、マイカと申します。

conversation.en_sentence: How may I assist you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: ご用件は何でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Ma'am, I understand your frustration.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様のお気持ちお察しします。

conversation.en_sentence: Please calm down so that I can better assist you.
conversation.ja_sentence: お力になれますので、どうか落ち着いて頂けないでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: May I please have your name and tell me about the situation?
conversation.ja_sentence: お名前と状況を伺ってもよろしいでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: First of all, I am so sorry to hear what happened.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずはこの様な事が起こってしまい、ご迷惑をお掛けした事にお詫びを申し上げます。

conversation.en_sentence: I understand you are very upset about this.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様のお怒りは理解できます。

conversation.en_sentence: But I would like to inform you that our product should not contain any nuts as the label shows.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、ラベル表示されている通りナッツが含まれている事はないはずです。

conversation.en_sentence: It is processed at a nut-free factory.
conversation.ja_sentence: ナッツフリー工場で製造されています。

conversation.en_sentence: So it can not be cross contaminated.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、交差汚染されている可能性もございません。

conversation.en_sentence: Would you please send us those pictures.
conversation.ja_sentence: それらの写真を送って頂いてもよろしいでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Also could you provide us with the lot number on the product?
conversation.ja_sentence: それから商品に記載されているロット番号も教えて頂けますでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I will let the factory manager know about this immediately so that they can look up the sample.
conversation.ja_sentence: サンプル回収の為、工場長にこの事についてすぐに連絡を入れます。

conversation.en_sentence: One more thing, can you provide a phone number we can call back?
conversation.ja_sentence: それと、折り返しお電話できる番号を教えて頂けますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Again I sincerely apologize for the frustration.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご迷惑をお掛けしたことを改めてお詫び申し上げます。

conversation.en_sentence: As soon as I hear from our factory, I will give you a call back.
conversation.ja_sentence: 工場から連絡が入り次第、すぐに連絡いたします。

conversation.en_sentence: Come in.
conversation.ja_sentence: お入りください。

conversation.en_sentence: Have a seat.
conversation.ja_sentence: お掛けください。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、お元気ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: So can you do a quick introduction of yourself?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、手短に自己紹介をして頂けますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, where did you go?
conversation.ja_sentence: へぇ、どちらへ行かれたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: How long were you there for?
conversation.ja_sentence: どれくらい居たんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: And you finished your last year of high school in Japan?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、高校の最終学年を日本で終えられたんですね？

conversation.en_sentence: Was the cultural transition difficult?
conversation.ja_sentence: 文化的な変化は困難でしたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても興味深いですね。

conversation.en_sentence: So tell me why you want to work at our company.

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.en_sentence: One of the important thing that you need to have is the ability to persevere.
conversation.ja_sentence: 持ち合わせていなければならない重要なものの一つは、やり抜く力です。

conversation.en_sentence: Sometimes things may not go smoothly but you will have to grind it out and see things through.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時には物事がスムーズにいかないこともあるかもしれませんが、それに立ち向かい、やり抜くことが必要です。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you have the perseverance to succeed?
conversation.ja_sentence: 成功するための、辛抱強さをお持ちだと思われますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Good to hear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが聞けて良かったです。

conversation.en_sentence: So on to the next question.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、次の質問へ進みましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you settled in, Kazuo?

conversation.en_sentence: Then you should ask Mrs. Coleman in the Human Resources for suggestions.
conversation.ja_sentence: それならば人事部のコールマンさんに聞いてみたらいいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: She knows just about every single doctor in town, both good and bad.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はこの町の良い医者、悪い医者、すべて知ってますからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you had a chance to meet all the employees at the office?
conversation.ja_sentence: 従業員全員に会う機会はありましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Glad to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かったです。

conversation.en_sentence: We, southerners, are known for our hospitality.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たち南部人は親切な事で有名ですから。

conversation.en_sentence: I am glad you feel welcome here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 喜んでもらえてる様で何よりです。

conversation.en_sentence: People in Japan don't dress up for Halloween?
conversation.ja_sentence: 日本人はハロウィンに仮装しないのですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I have so much respect for that.
conversation.ja_sentence: その点尊敬します。

conversation.en_sentence: Perhaps you can bring some of the seriousness to our office.
conversation.ja_sentence: その真剣な姿勢をここで見せて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: We always try to do something fun to make our work days enjoyable.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも楽しみながら業務できる様に色々工夫しているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We have our annual ugly sweater party for Christmas coming up in a few weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: 数週間後には毎年恒例のクリスマス、可笑しなセーターパーティーをします。

conversation.en_sentence: We will dress up in green for St. Patrick's day in March too,
conversation.ja_sentence: 3月のセント パトリックスデーには緑の洋服を着ます。

conversation.en_sentence: We usually go for a drink after work that day.
conversation.ja_sentence: その日は仕事の後にみんなで飲みに行くんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Kazuo, I am so glad to have you here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 和夫さんがここに来てくれて良かったです。

conversation.en_sentence: If there is anything I can do, please do not hesitate to ask me for help.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし何か私にできる事があれば、遠慮せずに言ってくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We have been using a few social media platforms for the last several years.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここ数年間、幾つかのソーシャルメディアサイトを利用してきました。

conversation.en_sentence: We have been successful at them to some degree.
conversation.ja_sentence: ある程度は好評です。

conversation.en_sentence: But some things need improvement.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ幾つか改善しないと’いけない点もあります。

conversation.en_sentence: Our page on the social media F started off as a success.
conversation.ja_sentence: ソーシャルメディアFのページは始めは好評でした。

conversation.en_sentence: But a lot of young people are not using it as much as they used to.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも大抵の若者は以前ほどFを利用していないんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: They prefer microblogging platforms such as I or T.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らはIやTなどのマイクロブログサイトを好んでいます。

conversation.en_sentence: We have been using them for a few years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何年もやっていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: But here is the problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ問題が一つあります。

conversation.en_sentence: We do not have an employee who can manage all those platforms.
conversation.ja_sentence: ソーシャルメディアサイトをきちんと管理する従業員がうちにはいません。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me explain how it is going to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: どの様な仕組か説明しますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Many companies have their own Social Media Marketers to promote their products online.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大抵の会社はソーシャルメディアマーケターが居て、オンラインで商品の宣伝をしています。

conversation.en_sentence: A lot of them actually work only a couple of hours a day from home.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多くのマーケターは一日数時間在宅で働いています。

conversation.en_sentence: All we need is someone to post one to two posts with eye-catching pictures a day.
conversation.ja_sentence: 毎日目につきそうな写真付き投稿を1、2件してくれる人がいれば大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、それもです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your kind understanding, Mr. Kotani.
conversation.ja_sentence: 小谷さん、ご理解頂き有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Will, I was told to come see you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ウィルさん、話があると聞いたのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: You could have told me in the breakroom earlier.
conversation.ja_sentence: さっき休憩室で話してもらって良かったんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You are beating around the bush, Mr. Will.
conversation.ja_sentence: ウィルさん、回りくどい言い方してますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you cut to the chase?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何を言いたいんでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: What, what did I do to get fired?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええっ、首になる様な事しましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Am I the only one getting laid off?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私一人だけ解雇されるんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: While I understand you, I just can't lose my job right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 状況は理解できますが、今解雇されるのは無理です。

conversation.en_sentence: I have a new baby coming next month!
conversation.ja_sentence: 来月子供が生まれるんです！

conversation.en_sentence: I truly appreciate your gesture.
conversation.ja_sentence: 色々有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess there isn't anything I can do.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私ができる事は何もないんですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I need to get started on job hunting right away.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに職探しを始めないといけませんね。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you told Andy about this already?
conversation.ja_sentence: アンディにはこの事を伝えましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Believe me, I feel very despondent too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 信じ難いかもしれませんが、私だって落胆してます。

conversation.en_sentence: But I have accepted the fact.
conversation.ja_sentence: でももう事実を受け止めました。

conversation.en_sentence: They say, "When one door closes, another door opens."
conversation.ja_sentence: 一つドアが閉まると、もう一つ開くと言いますしね。

conversation.en_sentence: This could be a blessing in disguise.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最終的には良い事に繋がるかもしれないです。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what's the matter?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、どうしたの？

conversation.en_sentence: Are you talking about Billy's?
conversation.ja_sentence: ビリーの机の事？

conversation.en_sentence: I see so many papers stacked up there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 書類が山程溜まっているみたいね。

conversation.en_sentence: I would not want to work next to him either.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も彼の隣では仕事はしたくないね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am surprised Mr. Urata hasn't made him straighten his desk up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 浦田さんが片付けるようにまだ指示していないなんて驚いた。

conversation.en_sentence: How can anybody work efficiently in a messy space like that.
conversation.ja_sentence: あんなに散らかしたまま効率良く仕事ができる人が居るんだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Billy's work has always been more than satisfactory.
conversation.ja_sentence: ビリーの仕事振りはいつも申し分ないんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Even Mr. Urata has commented on how efficient he is.
conversation.ja_sentence: 浦田さんも彼がどれだけ有能か話していたし。

conversation.en_sentence: Then you need to tell him to do something about the mess.
conversation.ja_sentence: なら、どうにかする様に言うべきだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Maybe you can write him an anonymous letter concerning the state of his desk.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼のデスク状態について匿名レターを書いてみるのはどう？

conversation.en_sentence: Write it as professionally as possibile.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるべくプロフェッショナルに書くの。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure it includes that his messy desk hinders the coworkers from focusing on their work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 散らかったスペースのせいで同僚が仕事に集中できないという事を必ず含めて。

conversation.en_sentence: It's either you do this or continue to be affected by his mess.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうするか、このままずっと彼の散らかし放題の犠牲になるかだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I could do that for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいよ、私がやってあげる。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you want to grab dinner together tonight?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日一緒に夕飯食べる？

conversation.en_sentence: I can help you then.
conversation.ja_sentence: その時に手伝ってあげる。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Kellar, do you have a moment?
conversation.ja_sentence: ケラーさん、ちょっといいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Do you happen to know if the sales manager position has been filled?
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業部マネージャーのポジションはもう決まったか知ってますか？

conversation.en_sentence: A friend of mine is also interested in applying.

conversation.en_sentence: She is currently working at company L.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今L社に勤務しています。

conversation.en_sentence: And her sales records are second to none.

conversation.en_sentence: She has a great work ethic and she is very personable.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はしっかりした労働観を持っているし、とても人当たりも良いです。

conversation.en_sentence: You would love her instantly.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ彼女の事を伝えておきたくて。

conversation.en_sentence: She would be a great asset to this company.
conversation.ja_sentence: この会社で貴重な存在になると思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I completely understand that.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかっています。

conversation.en_sentence: Can she mail her resume and cover letter?
conversation.ja_sentence: 履歴書とカバーレターを送付して大丈夫ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Things have obviously changed since I applied here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が応募した時から随分変わりましたね。

conversation.en_sentence: Can my name be put down as one of her references?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の名前を紹介者として載せても良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for all the information.
conversation.ja_sentence: 色々教えて下さって有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I will relay this message to her.
conversation.ja_sentence: この事を彼女に伝えておきますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, that's why they get paid the big bucks.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、だから彼らは大金を稼いでいるわけよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Seriously though, you're right.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど本当にその通りよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Doctors are held accountable for their work because it is often a matter of life or death.
conversation.ja_sentence: 生死に関わる事が多いんだから医師は責任が重いわね。

conversation.en_sentence: If they make a mistake, they can lose their licenses, their jobs, and even be sued.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもミスをしたら、免許も仕事も失い、さらには訴えられる可能性があるんだから。

conversation.ja_sentence: 間違いを犯したのならば、罰せられる必要があるというのは分かるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then again, often times surgeries are extremely difficult, and sometimes it's unavoidable.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、たいてい手術はとても難しいし、時にはミスが避けられないこともあるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I love what I do.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、私は自分の仕事が好きよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It has a very low stress level.
conversation.ja_sentence: ストレスレベルの低い仕事よね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, I received my MBA in management last year.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう、私は去年マネージメントのMBAを取得したわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Several.
conversation.ja_sentence: いくつかあるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: It's a great way to build a network of professional colleagues across several industries.
conversation.ja_sentence: 様々な業界にまたがるプロフェッショナルな同僚のネットワークを構築するための素晴らしい方法ね。

conversation.en_sentence: Having an MBA also a quick way to advance your career.
conversation.ja_sentence: 後はMBAを持つことはキャリアアップの手っ取り早い手段でもあるわ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.

conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます、シェンク教授はいらっしゃいますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Professor Schenk, the reason I'm calling is that I'd love to open a dialog with you in regards to your chemistry 101 course.

conversation.en_sentence: My name is Bob Dobbs.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はボブ・ドブスと申します。

conversation.en_sentence: I can tell that you are a very savvy consumer when it comes to your students needs Professor Schenk.

conversation.en_sentence: Sure Nancy, give me five minutes, I will be right there.

conversation.en_sentence: Um, she's nice, still getting used to the environment, I think.

conversation.en_sentence: But she is a good worker, she responds really well.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、いい働きぶりで、反応もすごくいいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: トム ワイスマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: When I ask her to do things for me, she's always very pleasant and attentive.

conversation.en_sentence: I sometimes see her not taking any lunch break, working right through.

conversation.en_sentence: You should tell her to pace herself more.

conversation.en_sentence: I guess, maybe I can ask her out to lunch sometime.

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, I will start with asking her to get some data from business development team.

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know if there is parking near their office?
conversation.ja_sentence: オフィスの近くに駐車場があるか知ってる？

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, thank you for checking.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうか、チェックしてくれてありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Honestly, not really.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、まだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: I need to do some homework and learn a bit more about their company.
conversation.ja_sentence: B社についてもう少し勉強しないといけない。

conversation.ja_speaker: リッキー 奥村さん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's have another meeting tomorrow to review their company and what we should talk about.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日もう一度、彼らについて、また何を話すかについておさらいするミーティングをしよう。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you all for gathering on such short notice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 突然のお願いなのに、集まってくれて助かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to straighten out all my accounts before I leave, and I thought you were the best people to hand over my files to.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が去る前に、顧客全てについて整理しておきたく、私のファイルを引き継ぐのにはあなたたちが最適だと思ったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm really sorry, Eugina.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当にごめんなさい、ユージニアさん。

conversation.en_sentence: I would love to stay if management was, well, um, decent.
conversation.ja_sentence: あの、えっと、経営陣がまともなら、残りたかったんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I've divided up the files into 5, so each one of you will have at least one blue chip in there.
conversation.ja_sentence: ファイルを５つに分けましたので、皆さん各人、そこに載っている優良顧客を少なくとも1件ご担当いただきます。

conversation.en_sentence: The rest of the accounts are very respectable too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の顧客もとてもちゃんとしています。

conversation.en_sentence: They are all ongoing accounts or solid leads, and all are eager to do business with us.
conversation.ja_sentence: 進行中の顧客や確かな見込み顧客で、全員、弊社との仕事に興味をもっています。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I have contacted them all to say each one of you are taking over.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、全員に連絡して、皆さんひとりひとりが引き継ぐことを伝えました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm just trying to make the transition as smooth as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるべくスムーズに引き継げるようにしているだけのことです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, trust me I am going to miss you guys more.
conversation.ja_sentence: あら、本当に、私だって寂しいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: The only thing that kept me here is you guys.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここに居続けられたのは皆さんのおかげですから。

conversation.en_sentence: Please contact the companies in the files first thing next month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来月になったらすぐに、ファイルにある会社へ連絡してください。

conversation.en_sentence: You will be able to pick up where I left.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が終えた時点からすぐに引き継げますから。

conversation.en_sentence: I wouldn't have been able to do any of this without your support.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんのサポートなしにはできなかったと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: So thank you, for allowing me to be part of your team.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、こちらこそ、チームの一員にしてくれてありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm so lucky I got to know you guys.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんにお会いできてよかったです。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Where is Taichi?
conversation.ja_sentence: 太一君はどこ？

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: He is the last to move and I am ready for him to move.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最後に移動する予定なのが彼で、もう移動してもらっていいんだけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Okay then I guess we have to move his desk before the phone company gets here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった、じゃ、電話会社が来るまでに私たちで彼の机を動かさないとね。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Can you hold that side Won Bin, and Yumi and I will hold this side.
conversation.ja_sentence: ウォンビンさん、そっちを持って、で、由美さんと私がこっち側を持つから。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Ugh, I hate it when I have to go through other people's desk.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、人の机の中を触るのって嫌いなのよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: You never know what's in there.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何が入ってるか分からないじゃない。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: There could be biohazards.
conversation.ja_sentence: バイオハザードってこともあり得るわ。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: But these are uniformly flat.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、これは全部一貫してぺったんこだわね。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: It doesn't look like a rock to me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私には石には見えないけど。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Ew, gross.
conversation.ja_sentence: あー、気持ち悪い。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: I told you it could be hazardous.
conversation.ja_sentence: ハザードでもあり得るって言ったじゃない！

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Quick, get your masks and disposable gloves and throw these away.
conversation.ja_sentence: 急いで、マスクと使い捨て手袋をとってきて、捨てちゃいましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please quarantine everything he touches.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、彼が触る物は全部隔離しちゃって。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: I don't need any explaining.
conversation.ja_sentence: 説明はいらないわ。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: Here, take the cloth and just clean your drawers until it doesn't smell like dead sandwiches.
conversation.ja_sentence: 雑巾を持ってきて腐ったサンドイッチの匂いが消えるまで、引き出しを綺麗にしてちょうだい。

conversation.ja_speaker: オフィスマネージャー
conversation.en_sentence: No more food in the office for you, Taichi.
conversation.ja_sentence: 太一君、もうオフィスでは物を食べるのは禁止よ。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes they did.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ありました。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Here's the list.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここにリストがあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think it would be best if we screen it on our side and make it shorter.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらで選りすぐって、短くするのがいいと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I mean there are some that are not realistic.
conversation.ja_sentence: つまるところ、中には現実的ではないものもありますから。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like this one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えばこれですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: New materials from space.
conversation.ja_sentence: 宇宙からの新材料。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Are they serious?
conversation.ja_sentence: 真剣に言ってるんでしょうかね。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Anyways, I think we should focus on ones that can synergize with our current operations.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、今のうちの経営にシナジー効果があるものに力を入れるほうがいいと思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So technology that can optimize operations and reduce operating costs.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、経営を最適化し経営コストを削減してくれるテクノロジーかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah I think companies like Company A has already introduced robots in their warehouses.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、A社のような会社はすでにロボットを倉庫に導入しているみたいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Apparently the robots can move products around when an order comes in.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやら、注文が入るとロボットが商品を移動させられるらしいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think robotics is definitely something we would like to keep our eyes on.
conversation.ja_sentence: ロボット工学は、まさにうちが目を付けておくべきところだと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to need to do more homework on these topics.
conversation.ja_sentence: それらトピックに関しては、私はもう少し勉強が必要ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So the next steps will be to make a shortlist from this list.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、次にやることはここから短めのリストを作ることですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: 奥村 リッキーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Then we will try to find companies that match our interest.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから私たちの興味にあった企業をさがしてみましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Sam Lee from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のサムリーです。

conversation.en_sentence: I was wondering if you can get me a quote for an air freight.
conversation.ja_sentence: 航空便の見積をいただけるかと思いました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, we're sending a trial shipment to Japan.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、日本へ試験輸送をしようと思ってるんで。

conversation.en_sentence: The customer wants it as soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客さんから出来るだけ早くとお願いされています。

conversation.en_sentence: It will be one pallet.
conversation.ja_sentence: １パレット分です。

conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, good question.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、それはいい質問ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I will need to double-check and get back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとで再確認して連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: How much does it cost these days to ship something by air?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近、航空便輸送はどのくらいの料金でしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Right.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ。

conversation.en_sentence: Aside from the dimensions, what other information would you need to give me a quote?
conversation.ja_sentence: 大きさのほかに、見積を出すのに必要な情報はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll get those information and get back to you as soon as I can.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、情報を集めて、出来るだけすぐにお返事します。

conversation.en_sentence: How long will it take to get a quote once you have those information?
conversation.ja_sentence: 情報があれば、見積を出すまでにどのくらいかかりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですが、助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll send an email with the information.
conversation.ja_sentence: 情報はメールします。

conversation.en_sentence: No that will be all.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、これだけです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello this is Henry speaking.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、ヘンリートルドーですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm not too bad thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 元気でやってますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh!
conversation.ja_sentence: あっ！

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I thought I replied to that email.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのメールには返事したと思ってました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me see.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと待ってください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oops.
conversation.ja_sentence: おっと。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: It seems my reply was sitting in my outbox.
conversation.ja_sentence: その返事は送信トレイの中に入ったままになってたようです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I wonder why it didn't go through.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして送信されなかったんでしょうかね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will send it out now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今送りますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: But basically, I am free this week or next week for the meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、基本的には今週か来週なら会議の時間がありますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me know which date works on your side.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらで都合の良い日を教えてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Where will we have this meeting?
conversation.ja_sentence: 会議はどこでやりましょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will look forward to hearing from you then.
conversation.ja_sentence: お返事お待ちしています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー トルドーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では失礼します。

conversation.en_sentence: So Misato, how good are you with excel?
conversation.ja_sentence: 美里さん、Excelは得意ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Can you use pivot tables?
conversation.ja_sentence: ピボットテーブルは使えますか。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know how to use the formulas in the cell?
conversation.ja_sentence: セル内の数式の使い方は知っていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: え、そう。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you use excel in school?
conversation.ja_sentence: Excelは学校で習ったのかしら？

conversation.en_sentence: Ah, I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: あら、そうなんですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry, I didn't know a thing about excel when I first started working.
conversation.ja_sentence: 心配しないでいいですよ、私も働き始めたころはExcelについては何も知らなかったから。

conversation.en_sentence: Fortunately, we have an excellent teacher on excel.
conversation.ja_sentence: 幸い、うちにはExcelの良い先生がいるんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'd like you to meet my teacher.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の先生をご紹介しますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, he taught me the basics of excel.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、Excelの基本を教えてくれました。

conversation.en_sentence: But in the end, I realized that looking it up online was quicker.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、最終的には、インターネットで調べたほうが早いってわかったんですけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: How about I give you some assignment that uses excel?
conversation.ja_sentence: Excelを使った課題を与えるっていうのはどうだろう？

conversation.en_sentence: Our department is actually planning to buy a new company camera soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、うちの部署で、もうすぐ会社用のカメラを新しく買おうと予定しているんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you find three of four digital cameras and make a comparison chart on excel?
conversation.ja_sentence: 3つか4つ、デジタルカメラを探して、Excelで比較表を作ってもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'll leave that up to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはあなたにお任せします。

conversation.en_sentence: But things like picture of the camera, price, specification, and stuff would be helpful.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、カメラ本体の写真や値段、仕様なんかがあれば便利じゃないでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Henry Massey speaking.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、ヘンリー・マシ―です。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm doing great.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ。

conversation.en_sentence: What's the product?
conversation.ja_sentence: どういった商品ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.en_sentence: Ninety percent of our work is with Western Red Cedar.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの仕事の90パーセントはベイスギを取り扱っています。

conversation.en_sentence: So what's the catch?
conversation.ja_sentence: ところで欠点は何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: What's the price?
conversation.ja_sentence: 値段は？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: My email is Massey.Henry@CompanyB.com.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のアドレスはMassey.Henry@CompanyB.comです。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you also send me pictures of the product?
conversation.ja_sentence: 商品の写真も送ってもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Send it over and I can take a look at it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 送ってもらえたら目を通します。

conversation.en_sentence: I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: Not at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: とんでもないです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll look forward to hearing from you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 連絡待ってます。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでは。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for letting us see the product loading today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は製品の荷積みの様子をお見せ頂きありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Just over here?
conversation.ja_sentence: ここで良かったですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes I brought my own today.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、今日は自分の物を持参しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm ready.
conversation.ja_sentence: 準備万端です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How many containers do you guys usually load in a day?
conversation.ja_sentence: 普段１日に何個のコンテナに積載しますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How long does it take to load a container?
conversation.ja_sentence: 一つのコンテナに積載するのにどれくらいの時間がかかりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's just say a twenty foot container.
conversation.ja_sentence: では20フィートのコンテナとしましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: How many bags are on a pallet?
conversation.ja_sentence: 一つのパレットに何袋置いてあるんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see that there are some empty spaces at the end of the container.
conversation.ja_sentence: コンテナの上の部分に空いてるスペースがあるようですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is it possible to add a couple more bags there?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何袋か足すことは可能でしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think forty bags at the end would fit?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最後に40袋入ると思いますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: My customer may want to load as much as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の顧客はできるだけ積むことを希望されるかもしれないです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But let me also mention the potential risk in loading too much bags at the end.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかしたくさん袋を詰め込み過ぎるとリスクがあることも説明したいと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうする事にします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for showing me around today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はご案内いただき本当にありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク ジャンセンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク ジャンセンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm Mike Jansen from Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: B社のマイク ジャンセンです。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク ジャンセンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Here's mine.
conversation.ja_sentence: これが私のです。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク ジャンセンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, we are a manufacturer in California.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社はカリフォルニアにあるメーカーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク ジャンセンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But we also outsource some manufacturing to China.

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your time and will look forward to hearing from you.

conversation.en_sentence: It's a manufacturing facility so I wanted to review what environmental regulation I should watch out for.

conversation.en_sentence: I don't have that data for the planned commercial facility yet.

conversation.en_sentence: Will you be able to help set that up?

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well the first thing you have to know is the market price.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You can either refer to market reports and by talking with suppliers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 市場報告書を参考にしたり、業者と話をしたりするのもいいよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not just that.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It is important to have face-to-face conversation with them sometimes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時々彼らに直接会って話すことが大切なんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They will sometime tell you some things they won't tell you over email or phone.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのうち電子メールや、電話では話さないようなことも話してくれるだろうからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You never know when you might pick up a lead that will generate sales.
conversation.ja_sentence: どこでそれが売上を生み出すか分からないからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Since we are the middleman, we can't go over the top.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕たちは仲介人なので、トップを超えることはできないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I typically aim for two to five percent.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The customer is also aware of the general price level so they will know if we are taking too much margin.
conversation.ja_sentence: 顧客も大体の物価水準を分かっているので、もし僕たちが高く利益を得ればわかってしまうだろうね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: In that case, they might deal directly with the supplier or find another middleman.
conversation.ja_sentence: その場合、彼らは業者と直接取引するか、または他の仲介人を見つけるかもしれないね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Once that happens, it will be difficult to gain that customer's trust.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしそうなったら、僕たちは顧客の信用を得ることが難しくなってしまうよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think the key point is to understand the needs of both sides.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大事なことは両方のニーズを理解することだと思うよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You have to know how what kind of situation they are in.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: For example, if the customer is facing some difficulties we might consider lowering our margin to help them out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、顧客がもし困っているときは、僕たちは彼らを助けるために自分たちの利益を下げることを検討することがあるかもしれないよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's all about maintaining a good balance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良いバランスを保つことが全てだね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, get out there!
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ、もっと外に出ようよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I am assuming that the human resource director has already provided some orientation.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Before we start, feel free to ask any questions okay?
conversation.ja_sentence: それでは始めますが、もし何かあったら気軽に質問してください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We can get started on how we run our business in our commodity department.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well lumber is basically the form when a log is cut at a sawmill.
conversation.ja_sentence: 木材というのは基本的に丸太をのこぎりで切った状態のことをいいます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will be part of the lumber trading team here at Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は多分A社の木材貿易チームの一員となると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will first work with Elaine here who is in charge of documentations.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So what we mainly do at the lumber department is to export lumber.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It is exported to Japan to be used to build houses.

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They do.
conversation.ja_sentence: あります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: However, their demand for lumber exceeds their domestic capacity.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、日本の木材需要は国内の生産能力を上回ってるのです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Therefore, Japan imports lumber from throughout the world to meet their demand.
